intro: Coussarea cephaeloides, commonly known as the golden torch or flame bush, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bright yellow flowers that bloom in terminal clusters. The plant has opposite, simple leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking vibrant, long-lasting floral displays.
